Description: Lower body sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style, pottery heavy chalice; white slip (partly worn); interior glazed streaky black (partly worn); two pairs of added white bands; exterior: reserved with four brown bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The limited amount of decoration on the interior surface may suggest that this heavy chalice is an early vessel in the serioes.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1560) (phase 2)
